pull.title: wallet: Assert holding cs_wallet lock in GetAvailableCredit/GetAvailableWatchOnlyCredit [wip]
pull.body:
**Note:** Still investigating. WIP.

~~Add missing `cs_wallet` locks in `GetAvailableCredit`, `GetAvailableWatchOnlyCredit` and `CreateWalletFromFile`:~~
* ~~`GetAvailableCredit` and `GetAvailableWatchOnlyCredit` read the variables `mapTxSpends` and `mapWallet` via the call to `IsSpent(...)` without holding `cs_wallet`.~~
* ~~`CreateWalletFromFile` reads the variable `nTimeFirstKey` without holding `cs_wallet`.~~

rename.from: wallet: Add missing cs_wallet locks in GetAvailableCredit/GetAvailableWatchOnlyCredit/CreateWalletFromFile
rename.to: wallet: Add missing cs_wallet locks in GetAvailable{,WatchOnly}Credit and CreateWalletFromFile

events.body:
This fails with

```
bitcoind: sync.cpp:98: void potential_deadlock_detected(const std::pair<void*, void*>&, const LockStack&, const LockStack&): Assertion `false' failed.
```

You might be able to compile with `-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER` locally and get a verbose output.

rename.from: wallet: Add missing cs_wallet locks in GetAvailable{,WatchOnly}Credit and CreateWalletFromFile
rename.to: wallet: Add missing cs_wallet locks in GetAvailable{,WatchOnly}Credit and CreateWalletFromFile [WIP]

events.body: Maybe just assert the lock is held?

events.message:
wallet: Assert holding cs_wallet locks in GetAvailableCredit/GetAvailableWatchOnlyCredit

GetAvailableCredit and GetAvailableWatchOnlyCredit read the variables
mapTxSpends and mapWallet via the call to IsSpent(...). These are
guarded by cs_wallet.

rename.from: wallet: Add missing cs_wallet locks in GetAvailable{,WatchOnly}Credit and CreateWalletFromFile [WIP]
rename.to: wallet: Assert holding cs_wallet lock in GetAvailableCredit/GetAvailableWatchOnlyCredit

events.body:
@promag Oh, you're right that the callers are locking properly - my annotations fooled me here. Thanks for reviewing. I've now changed to `AssertLockHeld(â€¦)`.

Would you mind taking a look at the potential deadlock (reported when building with `-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER`) discussed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11591#discussion_r148608970? The potential deadlock is not triggered when doing `make check` but `test/functional/test_runner.py` triggers it.

rename.from: wallet: Assert holding cs_wallet lock in GetAvailableCredit/GetAvailableWatchOnlyCredit
rename.to: wallet: Assert holding cs_wallet lock in GetAvailableCredit/GetAvailableWatchOnlyCredit [wip]

comments.body: This lock causes problems. Removing temporarily. I'll investigate.
